Richard Nixon, Ike's vice president, recounted in the 1980s that about a year before his death Eisenhower admitted that his support for Egypt was his major foreign-policy mistake.
"[S]aving Nasser at Suez didn't help as far as the Middle East was concerned.
Nasser became even more anti-West and anti-U.S.," Eisenhower said.
